ISSUE.TITLE: podman completely deadlocks when copying to mounted volume
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description Podman hangs if copying to a container path backed by an existing, non-empty volume. Every other podman invocation will hang too, aslong this operation is stuck. Only terminating the operation is possible. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Create some nonemtpy volume 2. Create a container mounting this volume 3. Copy to the container, using the path of the volume Complete reproducer: ``` bash # Preparation mkdir -p /tmp/test echo "text" > /tmp/test/file A=$(podman create --volume build:/builds debian) podman cp /tmp/test/. $A:/builds podman container rm $A # Bug A=$(podman create --volume build:/builds debian) podman cp /tmp/test/. $A:/builds ``` ### Describe the results you received The `cp` operation just hangs indefinitely, aswell as every podman command. For example, aslong as the `cp` operation is not killed, running `podman ps` will block too. ### Describe the results you expected The operation to succeed (or possibly fail). COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fix a potential deadlock during `podman cp` Have one function without a `defer lock.unlock()` as one of the commands in it calls a function that also takes the same lock, so the unlock has to happen prior to function completion. Unfortunately, this is prone to errors, like the one here: I missed a case, and we could return without unlocking, causing a deadlock later in the cleanup code as we tried to take the same lock again. Fix is simple enough - add the missing unlock. Fixes #25585 Signed-off-by: Matt Heon <mheon@redhat.com>

Refactor the command to use `defer unlock()` to simplify and avoid any further errors of this type. Introduced by e66b788a514fb8df2c8b8d3c000e0d543bbd60df - this should be included in any backports of that commit. Fixes #25585 Signed-off-by: Matt Heon <mheon@redhat.com>
